data.title: Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: The system cannot find the file specified. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002)
data.body:
Hi,

I installed the newest version, overwriting a previous version that was at least 2 years old. I went straight to the settings to reset the settings, and set to open 'windowed'. Upon accepting the restart request, the program fails to launch with a 'Fatal Error' message. I've tried un-installing, and re-installing, but still get the 'Fatal Error' dialogue.

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: The system cannot find the file specified. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeAssembly.nLoadFile(String path, Evidence evidence)
   at System.Reflection.Assembly.LoadFile(String path)
   at OpenRA.Sound..ctor(String engineName)
   at OpenRA.Game.Initialize(Arguments args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

Regards,
Dominic Naylor.

data.title: Check terrain cost when testing pathable cells.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body: Fixes #11606.

data.title: Added a TerrainDebugOverlay
data.body: I added this to debug weird behavior of my trains near tunnels. Can also be used to investigate problems like https://github.com/OpenRA/ra2/issues/150. Complements https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/11211.

data.title: Added dynamic railroad track terrain to Tiberian Sun
data.body: Another small step towards https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2652.

data.title: Allowed aircraft to land on Tiberium and Veins
data.body: Added TS specific LandableTerrainTypes for aircraft on Veins and Tiberium. As requested in: #11746

data.title: Support randomized death animations
data.body: As requested by Nolt in IRC.

data.title: Rework mod enumeration and split content metadata into their own files.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
This reworks the mod enumeration and caching code so that we are able to create and mount one mod's filesystem inside and isolated from another mod.

While I was there I moved the last of the mod content code out of the engine, and added support for loading mods from arbitrary locations by specifying `Game.Mod=/full/path/to/your.oramod` (something we talked about a lot, but which I couldn't find a ticket for).

Fixes #11740.

data.title: Red Alert - Engineer capture of MCV cancels bulding production
data.body: Even if you have a defense ready to be placed it gets cancelled. Bug or feature? Players specifically build engineers on maps with no oil to do an early cancel on your production.

data.title: Go to ground command
data.body:
Just an Idea: 
Why not introduce a new hotkey command to **voluntarily supress your own infantry**, combined with a significant reduction on damage of artillery shells and yak-crashes!
So quick players can supress their infantry before desaster and artillery doesnt shred infantry so hard.

data.title: Minelayer announces "Unit repaired" after finishing reloading only (with no damage)
Change fix for issue #10113, instead stop engineers from attack moving
data.body: I believe that #10113 is the incorrect fix. It's confusing and counter-intuitive and drawing a box around troops only selects some. Numerous selection attempts are needed to move mixed troops into a transport. The proper solution (and I think the original RA did this) is to not have the engineers move when given an attack order. You have a group huddled together and you give an attack order. Those that can attack go running after the target. Those that can't, remain idle.

data.title: Crate drops shouldn't prevent units from moving onto the tile before the crate lands.
data.body:
A slight annoyance but I never really thought about it much before I watched the first seconds of this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xKHzfOg7gLw

I hope there's a way to make it so that you can stand directly below the drop and get the crate once it lands.

data.title: Clamp minimum damage to 1 unless versus value is 0 vs armor type
data.body: Issues like #11425 or #4778 could have been avoided that way.

data.title: Replace warhead Verses percentages with absolute damage values
data.body:
Instead of defining one Damage value and then setting percentage Verses values for each armor type, it might be a more sensible approach to set explicit base damage values versus each armor type and only use the main Damage field as fallback for armor types that don't have a custom damage defined.

This would reduce the number of percentage modifiers applied to damage by one, and make balancing a bit more easy and straightforward.

data.title: Minelayers can't get a group order
data.body:
Currently, if you select a group of minelayers, and want them to place the same minefield, only one minelayer will follow the order. 
You have to repeat the order for each minelayer.
![openra-2016-08-03t180618z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20139967/17376442/dd4c2050-59b5-11e6-9a21-8efd36298d77.png)

data.title: Question: what infiltration types are there?
data.body:
as title.

I've been trying to get the thief to work again but it wont infiltrate for cash unless I make it infiltrate for everything.

data.title: "Select units by type", across screen
data.body:
If I understood how the "Select all combat units" hotkey works : when nothing is selected, the range is the screen. If a unit is already selected, the range is the map.

But for "Select units by type", it's always across the map. 

Could sth like that be implemented also for the "Select units by type" hotkey ? So we can select across screen only. For instance : first usage's range is the screen, second is the map. 

Selecting across the map just messes up everything if you have multiple armies on different fronts.

data.title: Enemies try to hunt down walls in Survival01
data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/756669/17354490/454cbcd6-5949-11e6-8194-060ef64acf0e.png)

This means the mission won't properly end when the player should loose.

data.title: localised GPS effect?
data.body:
This is a question I need to ask, is it possible give a unit the ability to provide a localised GPS effect?
For example everything comes in range of it's detection area it drops a pip on them for the duration their in the detection area.

This is basically what Tiberium Sun's mobile sensor array did but I want to apply it to a custom unit in red alert.

data.title: TD Balance Change 08012016
data.body:
TD Balance Change 08012016.

The following is changed in this listing:

Concrete Wall price increase from 100 to 150.

Concrete Wall build time increase from 3 to 8 seconds.

Hummers/Buggies damage vs wood reduced from 20 to 10.

Hummers/Buggies damage vs armor reduced from 15 to 10.

Samsite cost reduced from 700 to 650.

Samsite construction time reduced from 32 to 28.

Oil Derrick HP increased from 500 to 1000.

Hospital HP increased from 1000 to 2500.

Bio Lab HP Increased from 1000 to 2500.

data.title: Remove the "Output Disabled" audio device and simplify platform initialization.

milestone.title: release-20161015
milestone.description: Stability release with burning trees and video installation.

data.body:
The sound engine parameter was added for three main reasons, which are all now invalid:
- To allow dedicated servers to run headless (no longer needed thanks to the overhaul in the last release)
- As an automatic fallback if OpenAL can't be initialized (broken somewhere between release-20150919 and release-20151224)
- As a way for people to completely mute audio (we now have a mute checkbox)

These plus #11252 (game crashes on launch if the "Output Disabled" option is selected in release-20160508) convinced me that this feature has outlived its usefulness and should be removed.

I also used this chance to clean up the platform initialization in general.

Fixes #11252.

data.title: custom unit crashes game on production
data.body:
I'm trying to make a custom unit for my mod but i get this crash

Red Alert Expanded Mod at Version v1
on map 065791667982ccb50a4c3acdd6c752430db9a4a8 (Behind The Veil by Kyrylo Silin).
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `OpenRA.YamlException`: ActorInfo("mobu") failed to initialize because of the following:
Missing:
OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ArmamentInfo 
Unresolved:
OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.WithMuzzleOverlayInfo: { OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.AttackBaseInfo, OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.ArmamentInfo }

   at OpenRA.ActorInfo.TraitsInConstructOrder()
   at OpenRA.Actor..ctor(World world, String name, TypeDictionary initDict)
   at OpenRA.World.CreateActor(Boolean addToWorld, String name, TypeDictionary initDict)
   at OpenRA.World.CreateActor(String name, TypeDictionary initDict)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Traits.Production.<DoProduction>c__AnonStorey1.<>m__0(World w)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.InnerLogicTick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.LogicTick()
   at OpenRA.Game.Loop()
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)

and this is the units code.

MOBU:
    Inherits: ^Tank
    Buildable:
        Queue: Vehicle
        BuildPaletteOrder: 160
        Prerequisites: fix, stek, ~vehicles.soviet, ~techlevel.high
    Valued:
        Cost: 1500
    Tooltip:
        Name: Mobile Bunker
        Description:  unique infantry transport.\n  Strong vs nothing\n  Weak vs everything
    Health:
        HP: 1000
    Armor:
        Type: Heavy
    Mobile:
        Speed: 71
        Crushes: wall, mine, crate, infantry, heavywall
        UpgradeTypes: notmobile
        UpgradeMaxEnabledLevel: 0
    RevealsShroud:
        Range: 5c0
    AttackGarrisoned:
        Armaments: garrisoned
        PortOffsets: 384,0,128, 224,-341,128, -224,-341,128, -384,0,128, -224,341,128, 224,341,128
        PortYaws: 0, 176, 341, 512, 682, 853
        PortCones: 88, 88, 88, 88, 88, 88
    AutoTarget:
    Cargo:
        Types: Infantry
        MaxWeight: 5
        PipCount: 5
        LoadingUpgrades: notmobile
    ProducibleWithLevel:
        Prerequisites: vehicles.upgraded

so the question is does Openra support garrisioned attackers in vehicles and if not is it possible it can be added at a later date?

data.title: Evacuation issue
data.body:
#6754 followup

on bleed ... 
1. Create a server with any map (singleplayer or multiplayer doesnt matter)
2. While on the server, pick the mission "Evacuation" (or a minigame , just something with different options)
3. Leave the server (check the options before)
4. Create server again (leave map as is , should be Evacuation or the mini-game you had before)
5. Now pick a standard conquest map ... 
6. Check the options 

the conquest-map should now have the same options as Evacuation (Boac off, short game off) and every map you pick afterwards ... will have the same options as Evacuation unless you start your server with a standard conquest-map

@pchote : http://i.imgur.com/gDQk9GQ.gif :)

Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)

I don't understand whats happening.

data.title: Allow VS2015 to format solution file
data.body:
Allowing VS to format this file as it likes means users of this IDE don't need to reset it each time VS decides to streamroll over it with arbitrary changes.

Updates version number to VS2015 Update 3 and sorts files in its preferred order. (See also #11363)

data.title: Added SpawnDelay for SpawnActorOnDeath trait
data.body: This new property will delay actor spawn on death (useful when you need to play unit's death animation first without overlapping dead actor and new actor)

data.title: TD and RA install error when trying to extract from the First Decade disk
data.body:
I was trying to install Tiberian Dawn and Red Alert form my CD but when I tried to, openra crashed and left this exception.log :

```

Mod Chooser Mod at Version release-20160508
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.2.9200.0)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.42000
Exception of type `System.IO.FileNotFoundException`: File not found: E:\data1.hdr
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.FileSystem.Open(String filename)
   at OpenRA.FileSystem.InstallShieldCABExtractor..ctor(FileSystem context, String hdrFilename)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.InstallFromCDLogic.<InstallTFD>c__AnonStorey1.<>m__0()
   at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart_Context(Object state)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state, Boolean preserveSyncCtx)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state, Boolean preserveSyncCtx)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state)
   at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart() 

```

The file it is asking for exists and I can install TFD normally from this disk.
